So i discovered the Mun part- and just had to put it into orbit (that was fun....)

But i was wondering- if you put 2 Mun\'s into oposite orbits on the same line- would they bounce off of each other- and reverse orbit- and if they would could you rig it so that they impacted on opposite side of Kearth and keep doing so. Kinda like the stupid metal balls that i have on my desk at work.

So heres my challenge- 2 Muns- same orbit opposite directions- bouncy bouncy

Yes im crazy- but its fun

I know what i said above is kinda gibberish but im sure one of the rocket scientist on these forums can put it into some language that will make sense.

I deem this challenge humanly impossible, however, if you build a rocket that automatically puts the mun into orbit, then somehow splice 2 of them together facing opposite directions then yes, its possible, but not humanly possible. BTW they\'re called Newton Balls

BTW they\'re called Newton Balls
